title: "How to organize and classify information in your mind"
first_phrase: In this text, the author provides a method to better organize and retain information in our minds. They suggest creating a mental "file" for each subject and breaking it down into sections. As an example, the author describes how to organize information about health. By doing this, we can easily and permanently retain knowledge. This method is useful when studying a new subject as well. The author advises finding a place for it in our existing knowledge, creating a general understanding and creating a mental file for it. This approach helps us concentrate on the subject of interest.

last_phrase: In conclusion, to effectively combat potential illnesses, prioritize preventive hygiene measures. When studying new subjects, place them within the context of your existing knowledge, create a general understanding, and focus on central connections. To retain useful ideas, create and quickly fill mental cards, associating them with relevant aspects and determining their timing. When visualizing material things or people, imagine satisfying your desires with them.
